articles.title: Kim Jong Un Inspects KPA Unit
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Inspects KPA Unit
						
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un inspected KPA Unit 323 honored with the title of O Jung Hup-led 7th Regiment.  
					 He was greeted on the spot by General Ri Pyong Chol, commander of the KPA's Air and Anti-Air Force, and commanding officers of the unit.
					
					 After giving a pair of binoculars and an automatic rifle to the company directly belonging to the unit and a pair of binoculars, an automatic rifle and a machine gun to the 3rd company of its first battalion as gifts, Kim Jong Un had a photo taken with officers of the command and soldiers of the companies.
					
					 Conducted by commanding officers, he looked round the rooms devoted to the education in the revolutionary history and the unit's history.
					
					 He said he wished to meet the soldiers so much loved by leader Kim Jong Il, adding he was able to spare time to visit them at last. "I'm very pleased to meet you and feel recovered from fatigue," he noted.
					
					 He also said he attaches greatest importance to this unit which President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il considered as important.
					
					 He reposed deep trust in it, saying that it should further step up its preparations for battles, well aware of the intention of the Supreme Commander, and play its big role in the showdown with the enemies. 
					
					 Looking round the soldiers' hall and library, he was satisfied to learn that the unit was conducting fresh political and ideological education appropriate to the characteristic features of the soldiers by displaying lots of various data and building facilities for ideological and cultural education.
					
					 He went round a combined processing facility.
					
					 He was pleased that the unit was striving hard to improve the soldiers' diet with various kinds of processing equipment.
					
					 He made the rounds of military lecture rooms and a gymnasium to learn about the unit's training. 
					
					 He inspected the 4th battalion under the unit.
					
					 He gave a pair of binoculars, an automatic rifle and a machine gun to the 5th company of the battalion as gifts and had a photo session with the battalion soldiers.
					
					 He looked round the education room, barracks and wash-cum-bathroom of the company to take warm care of their living.
					
					 He went round the lecture room of O Jung Hup Political University to acquaint himself with its operation and indicated concrete orientation and ways for its improvement.
					
					 Then he dropped in at the mess hall. There he watched a program for observing the "Day for soldiers" and was pleased to know that commanding officers and their families were doing all their sincerity for soldiers. Seeing a variety of foodstuffs on the kitchen table, he learned in detail about the supply and consumption of non-staple food.
					
					 He guided the soldiers' training in a combined drill ground and looked round the unit's combat and technical equipment.
					
					 He was accompanied by Choe Ryong Hae, Hyon Yong Chol, Kim Yong Chun, Hwang Pyong So, Ra Chong Il, Hong Yong Chol and Pak Jong Chon.

articles.title: Contributors to Underground Nuclear Test Will Visit Pyongyang
articles.content:
Contributors to Underground Nuclear Test Will Visit Pyongyang
						
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- Scientists, technicians, workers, soldier-builders and officials who fully demonstrated the tremendous might of the great Paektusan nation by successfully conducting the third underground nuclear test will come to Pyongyang under the care of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The recent successful underground nuclear test was a special event produced by the iron faith and will and the matchless grit and pluck of the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un, illustrious commander of Mt. Paektu. It was also a historic result of the devoted efforts by the scientists, technicians, workers, soldier-builders and officials who have devotedly defended the party, revolution, country and its people on the forefront for an all-out action against the U.S.
					
					 They will spend significant days of Pyongyang visit, enjoying the greatest privileges and preferential treatment.
					
					 They will visit the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun where leader Kim Jong Il lies in state. They will also visit President Kim Il Sung's birthplace at Mangyongdae and other places in Pyongyang.
					
					 They will spend joyful and delightful time at the People's Open-air Ice Rink, Skate Park and other places.

articles.title: Meritorious Persons Who Succeeded in Nuclear Test Arrive Here
articles.content:
Meritorious Persons Who Succeeded in Nuclear Test Arrive Here
						
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- The people who took part in the work for the third underground nuclear test arrived here on Wednesday.
					 They are scientists, technicians, workers, soldier-builders and officials who demonstrated once again the spirit of Korea that it does whatever it is determined to do.
					
					 The whole city of Pyongyang was wrapped in a festive mood to welcome the heroes whom the nation should be proud of.
					
					 Crowds of Pyongyangites with bunches of flowers in their hands lined along the streets extending from Changjon Crossroads, Kim Il Sung Square, Pyongyang Grand Theatre, Yonggwang Street, Pyongyang Railway Station to Pyongyang Koryo Hotel.
					
					 Buses with those meritorious people aboard wove through the streets amid enthusiastic welcome.
					
					 As the buses arrived at Pyongyang Koryo Hotel, its employees put fragrant garlands around the necks of the meritorious people, and presented them with bunches of flowers.
					
					 They were warmly greeted by Kim Ki Nam and Pak To Chun, secretaries of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, and other officials of the Party Central Committee.

articles.title: Pyongyang City Seized with Welcoming Atmosphere
articles.content:
Pyongyang City Seized with Welcoming Atmosphere
						
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- Pyongyang citizens Wednesday enthusiastically welcomed those scientists, technicians, workers, soldier-builders and officials who arrived in the city with their pride of having contributed to the successful 3rd nuclear test.
					 Along the route extending several kilometers, many citizens, including schoolchildren, gave warm welcome to them, offering bouquets and flowers and chanting "Welcome" and "Congratulations".
					
					 A nuclear scientist told KCNA that it is unimaginable for them to get such welcome, saying they just did what they should do.
					
					 Jong Ki Yong, a 40-year-old woman living in Sosong District, said:
					
					 "There is nothing to spare for them. I extend heartfelt congratulations to them, laudable sons and daughters of the country." 
					
					 Han Si Jun, a 53-year-old man, said:
					
					 "The contributors to the nuclear test all deserve to be praised as great heroes of the country.
					
					 Their style of work serves as an example for all other people to follow in the efforts for the nation's security and prosperity.
					
					 I will devote my all to glorifying the country as they did."

articles.title: Pyongyang Citizens Warmly Welcome Contributors to Nuclear Test
articles.content:
Pyongyang Citizens Warmly Welcome Contributors to Nuclear Test
						
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- Scientists, technicians, workers, soldier-builders and officials who contributed to the DPRK's successful 3rd underground nuclear test arrived here on Wednesday.
					 Pyongyang citizens turned out to accord hearty welcome to them along the route with bouquets in their hands.
					
					 Seen in streets are slogan-boards and posters warmly congratulating the successful nuclear test and calling for full play to the national strength.
					
					 U Song Sil, a 76-year-old woman living in Tongdaewon District, told KCNA that she was very glad to see them who contributed to displaying the might of the country.
					
					 Rim Kwang Ung, a 43-year-old man living in Central District, said:
					
					 "I was very excited at the news about the successful nuclear test.
					
					 Today my family came here to welcome them who demonstrated the mightiness of the DPRK, which does what it is determined to do."
					
					 O Il Sok, a 38-year-old man living in Taedonggang District, said:
					
					 "I warmly congratulate those contributors, who displayed the invincible dignity and inexhaustible potentials of the great Paektusan nation.
					
					 The recent nuclear test, successfully conducted despite the escalating pressure of the imperialist allied forces, is evoking admiration from among the world's progressives.
					
					 The final victory is in store for the DPRK as it boasts of the single-minded unity, Juche-based scientific and technological foundations and the invincible army.
					
					 The U.S. and its followers should be mindful that it is a disposition of the DPRK to counter any provocation with prompt counterstrike and any aggression with a war of justice for national reunification."

articles.title: Pyongyangites Welcome Nuclear Developers
articles.content:
Pyongyangites Welcome Nuclear Developers 
						
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- Nuclear weapons developers who took part in the third underground nuclear test arrived in Pyongyang on Wednesday, being accorded warm welcome by many citizens.
					 Choe Jong Guk, a Pyongyang citizen, told KCNA:
					
					 "They (nuclear developers) are heroes of the nation as they responded with successful nuclear blast to the U.S. and its followers' violation of the DPRK's legitimate right to peaceful satellite launch.
					
					 It was not many days ago that the scientists, technicians, workers and officials who contributed to successfully launching the satellite had enjoyable days in Pyongyang. This time, the nuclear developers have come to Pyongyang.
					
					 Now I think the day will soon come when units of the Korean People's Army will march past this route with a shining victory in a sacred war for national reunification."
					
					 Kang Ryong Su, an officer of the Korean People's Army, said:
					
					 "The successful 3rd underground nuclear test has greatly encouraged the local people in the onward movement to significantly celebrate the 65th DPRK birthday and the 60th anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 Those contributors to the nuclear test are true patriots to be loudly praised by the nation."
					
					 Hwang U Gil, a doctor of the Pyongyang Maternity Hospital, said:
					
					 "The U.S. and its followers would be offended to see them (nuclear developers) being welcomed enthusiastically in Pyongyang.
					
					 It is the DPRK's steadfast stand to press ahead with the building of a prosperous and powerful country on the strength of self-reliant nuclear deterrent.
					
					 If the U.S. and the south Korean group of traitors dare ignite a nuclear war against the DPRK, its army and people will never miss the chance to wipe out those provokers with merciless deterrent and other powerful weapons of Korean style."

articles.title: More Army-people Rallies Hail Third Underground Nuclear Test
articles.content:
More Army-people Rallies Hail Third Underground Nuclear Test
						
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- Army-people rallies are being held in cities and counties to hail the successful third underground nuclear test.
					 Present there were officials of local party, power organs and working people's organizations, service personnel, officials and other people of factories, enterprises and cooperative farms and students of universities and colleges.
					
					 Speakers at the rallies held in Kaesong and Manpho cities and Ryongchon and Chonnae counties said the test was a great victory which demonstrated the limitless capacity and firm will of Songun Korea to defend its sovereignty, adding the test was a brilliant fruition of the wise leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 Speakers at the rallies held in Tongrim, Cholsan, Usi and Ryongrim counties extended the greatest glory and warmest thanks to the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un, who is firmly safeguarding valuable revolutionary heritages bequeathed by the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and wisely leading the efforts for glorifying the dignity of the country and nation.
					
					 Speakers at the rallies held in Uiju, Paechon and Chosan counties said the days when the enemies used to threaten and blackmail the DPRK with atomic bombs had already passed.
					
					 Those in the rallies in Yonan, Junggang, Thongchon and Chongdan counties called for fully displaying the honor of the army and people with high spirit of independence and glorifying this significant year which marks the 65th anniversary of the DPRK and 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War with triumphant merits.

articles.title: DPRK People Deem Nuclear Test Nation's Pride
articles.content:
DPRK People Deem Nuclear Test Nation's Pride
						
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- People in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea consider the country's recent third underground nuclear test to be a great pride of the nation.
					 Army-people rallies voicing support to the test have taken place one after another throughout the country.
					
					 Seen in and outside public buildings are visual aids reading "3rd nuclear underground test, representation of the military strength of Songun (military-first) Korea."
					
					 Kim Hyong Nam, manager of the Chollima Steel Complex, told KCNA:
					
					 "I think it is the greatest joy for each nation to have its dignity fully displayed all over the world.
					
					 The successful nuclear test, in the wake of the successful launch of satellite Kwangmyongsong 3-2, well demonstrated the DPRK's decisiveness.
					
					 The DPRK has now turned into a full-fledged nuclear weapons state." 
					
					 Song Myong Ho, chief engineer of the complex, said:
					
					 "The successful nuclear test is a great auspicious event as it heralded a bright future of the nation.
					
					 The test enhanced the Korean people's national pride. Nuclear deterrent is more precious than anything else for the Korean nation that has been constantly exposed to military threats from outside forces."
					
					 Ri Yong Ae, a doctor of the Pyongyang Maternity Hospital, said:
					
					 "DPRK's deterrent helps ensure the happy life of its people. The success in nuclear test greatly encourages the people of Songun Korea in the face-off with hostile forces."

articles.title: Floral Basket Laid before Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Basket Laid before Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
						
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- Scientists, technicians, workers, soldier-builders and officials who contributed to succeeding in the third underground nuclear test laid a floral basket and bouquets before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Wednesday before paying tribute to them.

articles.title: Singaporean Tourist Ship Opens Business at Rajin Port of DPRK
articles.content:
Singaporean Tourist Ship Opens Business at Rajin Port of DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- The Singaporean tourist ship "Royale Star" opened its business with due ceremony at Rajin Port in the northeastern DPRK on Feb. 20.
					 Present at the ceremony were officials and other people of DPRK and Chinese institutions related to tourism and people in Rason City.
					
					 Kim Chun Hwa, director of the Rason International Travel Company, the director of the Yanbian Tianyu International Travel Company of China, and Zheng Yuanhui, owner of the ship, made speeches at the ceremony. 
					
					 They said the start of business by the ship is of great significance in developing tourism in the Rason Economic and Trade Zone, adding it will contribute to bringing about a turn in the services for tourists. 
					
					 They expressed thanks to the DPRK for its cooperation in the preparations for the start of the ship's business.
					
					 They stressed the need to improve the services and inject fresh energy into Rason-Mt. Kumgang tour and the businesses in the zone.
					
					 At the end of the ceremony its participants toured cabins and other facilities of the ship.
					
					 A reception and an art performance were given on the same day.

articles.title: Kimjongilia Festival Goes On in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Kimjongilia Festival Goes On in Pyongyang
						
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- An endless stream of visitors is flowing to the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Exhibition, the venue of the 17th Kimjongilia Festival, every day.
					 The festival adding to the people's yearning for leader Kim Jong Il has been visited so far by hundreds of thousands of people.
					
					 Pavilions of the exhibition are decorated with potted Kimjongilias in full bloom and such letters as "Smile as bright as the sun", "People will remember General Kim Jong Il forever" and "Eternal life".
					
					 What catch the eyes are the pavilions of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, the Secretariat of the DPRK Cabinet, the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea and the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon).
					
					 The exhibits represent the ardent yearning of the local people for Kim Jong Il, who turned the Workers' Party of Korea into an invincible party and the DPRK into a country with strong military might. And they tell that the future of Songun (military-first) Korea is rosier as it is led by respected Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 They also make the visitors recall the tireless efforts Kim Jong Il made for national reunification.
					
					 Kim Ju Sun, an official of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee, told KCNA:
					
					 "Hundreds of potted Kimjongilias, displayed at this pavilion of Chongryon, mirror the deep reverence of Chongryon officials and Japan-resident Koreans for Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Frostworks and clear water of Sobaek Stream pictured here represent their germ-like mind to hold Kim Jong Il in high esteem forever."
					
					 Pavilions, prepared by the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and others, showcase the profound reverence of world's progressives for Kim Jong Il, who made tremendous contributions to global independence.
					
					 Among those exhibits are immortal flowers presented by foreign organizations for friendship with the Korean people, including Kim Il Sung Kindergarten in Mongolia, the France-Korea Friendship Association and the Peru-Korea Institute of Culture and Friendship, and 30 odd foreign embassies and missions of international agencies in Pyongyang.
					
					 Exhibits also came from some 40 foreign travel agencies.

articles.title: New Postage Stamps Issued in DPRK
articles.content:
New Postage Stamps Issued in DPRK
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- New kinds of stamps (a sheet and a sheetlet) have been issued in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 Printed in the sheet is a picture of the dear respected Kim Jong Un making his New Year address for 2013, against the background of fireworks display.
					
					 The sheetlet is made up of four individual stamps featuring the tasks set forth in the New Year address, on the theme of "Let us bring about a radical turn in the building of an economic giant with the same spirit and mettle as were displayed in conquering space!", the slogan laid down in the New Year address.
					
					 One stamp, with serviceperson, worker, peasant and student arm in arm pictured with letters reading "The great Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism", shows the fixed will of the Korean army and people to increase the political and military might of the country in every way, rallied closer around the Workers' Party of Korea, this year marking the 65th DPRK birthday and the 60th anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 Another stamp on the subject of "Agriculture and light industry constitute the main front in this year's economic construction" stresses the idea that a production upsurge should be effected in coal, power and metal industries and railway transport, the four major leading sectors of the national economy, and a springboard for building an economic power should be laid by dint of science and technology.
					
					 The two other stamps carry the ideas that building a highly civilized country should be sped up to open up a fresh age of civilization in the 21st century and Korea's reunification be realized on the basis of priority to the nation's interests and the stand for national unity through removal of confrontation between the north and the south and implementation of the north-south joint declarations.

articles.title: Weapon, Ammunitions Used by U.S. Imperialists during War Displayed in House of Class Education
articles.content:
Weapon, Ammunitions Used by U.S. Imperialists during War Displayed in House of Class Education
						
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- More weapon, ammunitions, etc. were displayed at the House of Class Education in Kaesong City, the DPRK, laying bare the crimes committed by the U.S. imperialists during the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Among the new exhibits are a weapon and unexploded shell used by the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces, which were unearthed at the construction site of the Ryongthongsa-Pakyon road, and 14 shells discovered in places around historic relics, machine-gun bullets and splinters of shells driven into a rock on top of Mt. Songak. 
					
					 The exhibits indict the U.S. imperialists for their crimes of reducing everything into ashes and even destroying precious historical and cultural relics after igniting the war of aggression on the peaceful land in the 1950s.

articles.title: Kim Rak Hui, Initiator of Plowwoman Movement
articles.content:
Kim Rak Hui, Initiator of Plowwoman Movement 
						
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Rak Hui (Nov. 1933-Feb. 2013) was a peasant who rose to fame as a plowwoman during the period of the Fatherland Liberation War (1950-1953).
					 Born in a rural community in South Phyongan Province, she worked as a weaver in her teens.
					
					 She began the plowwoman movement in March Juche 40 (1951) to contribute to supplying food to the People's Army in the war. She attended a meeting of frontrunner farmers held in 1952 and was highly praised by President Kim Il Sung for her devoted service.
					
					 Later, she was honored to receive a letter of thanks from the President for her big contributions to providing much relief food to the warfront.
					
					 In the post-war period, she overfulfilled grain output quota each year, as the chairwoman of an agricultural cooperative.
					
					 Under deep trust of the President and leader Kim Jong Il, she became a deputy to the Supreme People's Assembly and had worked as chairwoman of a county cooperative farm management committee, chairwoman of a provincial rural economy committee, deputy director of the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea, chief secretary of the South Hwanghae Provincial Committee of the WPK, and vice-premier and honorary councilor of the DPRK Cabinet.
					
					 She was awarded a lot of state citations, including Order of Kim Il Sung, Order of Kim Jong Il, title of Labor Hero and Order of National Flag 1st Class.
					
					 Some days ago, the dear respected Kim Jong Un sent a wreath to the bier of Kim Rak Hui to express his deep condolences over her death.

articles.title: Japan's Moves for Militarization, Overseas Expansion Assailed
articles.content:
Japan's Moves for Militarization, Overseas Expansion Assailed
						
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- Japan now moves to get allowance for the exercise of the right to collective self-defense through the retrogressive revision of the present constitution, rename the "Self-Defense Forces" the "national defense forces" and loosen the worldwide standard as for the use of weapons by SDFs under the pretext of "saving Japanese residing overseas".
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 This is the last-ditch efforts of the Japanese reactionaries to remove the hurdle in its way of becoming the "leader" of Asia, an ambition long harbored by them.
					
					 Citing facts to prove that Japan's moves for militarization and overseas expansion have reached a very adventurous phase, the commentary notes:
					
					 The world is now following Japan with great vigilance and concern as it is revealing its despicable colors as militarists.
					
					 Japan's moves for militarization and overseas expansion are gravely threatening the regional peace and security.
					
					 If Japan truly wants to become a normal state, it should be concerned about liquidating the unheard-of war crimes in the past including the heinous crimes against humanity, not resorting to such a mad act as retrogressively revising the constitution.
					
					 However desperate it may try to realize its old dream of the "Greater East Asia Co-prosperity Sphere", it will get nothing but destruction and death.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary on S. Korean Regime's Jitters about DPRK's Third Underground Nuclear Test
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary on S. Korean Regime's Jitters about DPRK's Third Underground Nuclear Test
						
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet regime is now in a fidget over the DPRK's proud success in the third underground nuclear test, an event worthy to be specially recorded in the history of the nation.
					 Shortly ago, the south Korean Intelligence Service in a report submitted to the "National Assembly" let loose a spate of nonsense that "the north has not yet reached the level of a nuclear weapons state" and "the north has not succeeded but is just working to make a miniaturized and lighter A-bomb".
					
					 "Defense Minister" Kim Kwan Jin also made a far-fetched assertion "he can not believe the announcement of the north just as it is".
					
					 They are making assertions out of common sense, as they are lost to even elementary discretion, being frightened by the DPRK's nuclear might.
					
					 Even the U.S., to say nothing of experts, admitted the DPRK's third underground nuclear test as successful.
					
					 This is vivid evidence showing the true picture of the DPRK, a sovereign state, which is demonstrating its dignity and the might as a full-fledged nuclear weapons state.
					
					 The puppet forces' groundless assertion can never undermine the inexhaustible might of the DPRK's defense industry.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group of traitors without elementary concept of coordinates misjudged the site of the DPRK's third underground nuclear test and made futile "observation" and "analysis" of a wrong place, ending in the waste of labor and drawing bitter criticism and derision at home and abroad.
					
					 They also set afloat a video of underground pit, asserting that they found out the structure of an underground pit at the time of the DPRK's 2nd nuclear test. But this was revealed to be imaginary scenes of a feature film, bringing them public disgrace.
					
					 It is none other than the Lee group which is making desperate efforts being ignorant of how the world goes around and the DPRK's potentials.
					
					 It is really disgusting that imbeciles bereft of elementary intellectual faculties of human being are making whole gamut of rhetoric, being lost to shame.
					
					 The south Korean puppet forces are no more than colonial watchdogs as they have nothing their own in the political, economic and military fields owing to the successive ruling forces' dependence on foreign forces and subservient policy.
					
					 The DPRK, which has chosen the road of independence in politics, self-support in economy and self-reliance in national defence, launched its own satellite and legitimately conducted the nuclear test. This meant the total bankruptcy of the south Korean regime's policies of sycophancy and confrontation with compatriots.
					
					 Rat-like Lee Myung Bak group has nothing to say about this. It is just making desperate efforts to downplay the consequences of the treacherous policy and cover up the truth of crimes it committed during the tenure of office.
					
					 The puppet forces are trying to deceive the public opinion but will get nothing from it.
					
					 Only their small and ugly appearance will be disclosed more glaringly to the world.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star Celebrated by Koreans in Uzbekistan
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star Celebrated by Koreans in Uzbekistan
						
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- Koreans in Uzbekistan held an event on Feb. 16, the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star).
					 Present there were Ju Yong Il, chairman of the "Old Men" Association for Korean Cultural Tradition in Uzbekistan, officials of Korean compatriots organizations, heads of the art troupes of Korean compatriots and other Korean compatriots.
					
					 The participants laid a floral basket and bouquets before the full-length painting of the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il at the DPRK embassy in Tashkent.
					
					 They watched a Korean film documenting revolutionary activities of Kim Jong Il energetically leading the work to strengthen the Korean People's Army.
					
					 There took place a photo exhibition on the theme of "The great Comrade Kim Jong Il of Korean people" on the same day.

articles.title: Korean Organizations in Europe Support DPRK's Underground Nuclear Test
articles.content:
Korean Organizations in Europe Support DPRK's Underground Nuclear Test 
						
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- The Society for Cooperation among Koreans in Germany and the European Regional Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification issued an article on Feb. 15 supporting the third underground nuclear test conducted by the DPRK.
					 The third underground nuclear test of the DPRK clearly stated to the world that it will not be affected by any "sanctions" and pressure and that it will never make any concession over its sovereign rights, said the article.
					
					 It is also a direct answer to the unreasonable "resolution on sanctions" adopted at the U.N. Security Council, which has been reduced to a puppet of the U.S., added the article.
					
					 The DPRK's people crushed the anti-socialist maneuvers persistently pursued by the imperialist forces even though they had to tighten their belts due to food shortage that was blamed on natural disasters, said the article.
					
					 The world justice and conscience stand by the DPRK, which is set to settle accounts with the U.S. imperialists, the article concluded.

articles.title: Japan's Crimes against Humanity Slammed
articles.content:
Japan's Crimes against Humanity Slammed
						
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- The General Association of Koreans in China issued a statement on Feb. 18 as regards the fact that the Japanese reactionaries are becoming evermore desperate in their moves against the DPRK and the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) with the DPRK's third underground nuclear test as an occasion.
					 The statement said:
					
					 On Feb. 12, Japanese Prime Minister Abe said that the vice-chairmen of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee are "of the stand of substantially assisting the north Korean authorities as their members" and announced that Japan will prohibit their reentry as a step of additional "sanctions".
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries' desperate action constitutes a serious challenge to the DPRK's dignity and sovereignty, and a crime against humanity and international law.
					
					 They, backed by the brigandish U.S. imperialists, groundlessly pulled up the DPRK whenever there were events demonstrating its national defence capability and set Chongryon as the first target of their hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					
					 They have made desperate efforts to tighten "sanctions" against the DPRK through UN and inflict its own additional "sanctions". They practiced vicious politically-motivated persecution against officials of Chongryon and Koreans in Japan. Their ultimate goal is to cut off kinship between the motherland and compatriots of Chongryon and put pressure upon the DPRK.
					
					 Indeed, they are the most vicious group of brutes in terms of politics and morality.
					
					 The officials of the General Association of Koreans in China and all Koreans in China will turn out as one in the struggle to check and frustrate the frantic suppression racket of the Japanese reactionaries who are running amuck to stifle Chongryon, the statement concluded.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary Marked in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary Marked in Foreign Countries
						
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- Meetings took place in Democratic Congo, Benin and Mexico between Feb. 5 and 12 to celebrate the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star).
					 Present there were personages of the preparatory committee of Democratic Congo for celebrating the Day of the Shining Star, Communist Party, Workers' Party, People's Rally for Socialism, Working Citizens' Association, National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of Democratic Congo and Democratic Congo-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Association, Socialist Party, National Committee for Celebrating the 71st Birth Anniversary of General Kim Jong Il, National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism and the Cotonou Institute of Journalism of Benin and the National Women's Union of Mexico and masses.
					
					 General Secretary of the Communist Party of Democratic Congo Boswa Isekombe Sylvere in his speech said the world progressives extend highest respects to Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The general secretary noted he is the sun as he successfully carried forward the revolutionary cause of Juche pioneered by President Kim Il Sung and clearly indicated the road to be followed by the progressive people.
					
					 He devoted his all to the people's happiness and the peaceful reunification of Korea by the concerted efforts of the Korean nation, said the general secretary, adding:
					
					 He will always be in the hearts of humankind for his immortal contributions to the times and history. 
					
					 President of the Socialist Party of Benin Ali Houdou praised Kim Jong Il for developing the Workers' Party of Korea into an experienced, seasoned and ever-victorious party.
					
					 Hessou Kohovi, chairman of the Benin National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, said ardent love for the people constitutes the personality of Kim Jong Il, adding that as he regarded the people as the heaven he could enforce the unprecedented benevolent politics.
					
					 Messages to the dear respected Kim Jong Un were adopted at the meetings.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Lauded as Eternal Leader of Progressive People
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Lauded as Eternal Leader of Progressive People
						
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 They included ceremonies of opening Korean book, photo and fine art exhibitions in Russia and Mexico and Korean book and photo exhibitions in Indonesia, Romania and South Africa between Feb. 9 and 16.
					
					 Displayed at the venues were photos showing the revolutionary activities of Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also displayed there were works of the peerlessly great men, books and photos introducing the invincibility of Songun Korea and fine art works showing the Korean people's talents.
					
					 A deputy mayor of Dmitrov City of Moscow Region of Russia praised Kim Jong Il as the eternal leader of the Korean people and the world progressives, who turned the DPRK into a political and military power and laid solid foundations for building an economic power with his outstanding leadership.
					
					 The general secretary of the Central Committee of the People's Socialist Party of Mexico spoke highly of the sacred revolutionary life of Kim Jong Il, who made immortal contributions to the cause of socialism and the human cause of independence, upholding the banner of Songun.
					
					 The chief of a fine art exhibition in Djakarta, Indonesia said the exhibition provided an opportunity for having a better understanding of the DPRK's Songun politics as a political mode that makes fresh changes in all fabrics of social life including politics and economy with the army as the main force, not just as the policy of attaching importance to the military affairs.
					
					 The chairman of the Romanian Socialist Union said it was thanks to the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il that the DPRK could become a nuclear weapons state and space power.
					
					 Kim Jong Il made immortal contributions to carrying out the Korean revolution and the cause of global socialism, especially to ensuring peace and security on the Korean Peninsula and in the rest of the world, the chairman added.

articles.title: Seminars on Kim Jong Il's Feats Held in Different Countries
articles.content:
Seminars on Kim Jong Il's Feats Held in Different Countries
						
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- Seminars on the exploits of leader Kim Jong Il took place in Nepal, Norway and Italy from Feb. 8 to 10 under the sponsorship of their preparatory committees for celebrating his birth anniversary (the Day of the Shining Star).
					 Displayed in the venues of the seminars were photos on noble revolutionary careers of the peerlessly great men who performed great feats for the times and humankind.
					
					 Also on show were works of Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Kim Jong Un and books and photos introducing the true picture of Songun Korea.
					
					 C. P. Mainali, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Nepal Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist), said:
					
					 The great exploits performed by Kim Jong Il are that he developed the Juche idea founded by President Kim Il Sung and formulated it as Kimilsungism, protected socialism from the imperialists' moves to stifle the DPRK with his Songun politics and provided solid foundations for country's reunification and people's happiness.
					
					 The DPRK proudly ranked itself among space powers under the wise leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un, who is identical to Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The general secretary bitterly denounced the U.S. and its followers for fabricating the UN Security Council's "resolution on sanctions" against the DPRK, and extended full support and solidarity to the Korean people in their just cause.
					
					 Dag Norum, chairman of the Ostfold County Committee of the Communist Party of Norway, lauded Kim Jong Il's Songun revolutionary leadership feats.
					
					 Constanzi Franco, secretary general of the Italian Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, praised Kim Jong Il as the great thinker and theoretician and great master of leadership recognized by the world, noting:
					
					 The successful launch of satellite Kwangmyongsong 3-2 fully demonstrated the tremendous might of the DPRK.
					
					 The Korean people will advance along the road of victory under the uplifted banner of socialism and surely build a thriving nation by dint of single-minded unity under the wise guidance of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Message of greetings to Kim Jong Un were adopted at the seminars held in Nepal and Norway.

articles.title: DPRK Demonstrates Its High Level of Scientific, Technological Development: Ukrainian Organizations
articles.content:
DPRK Demonstrates Its High Level of Scientific, Technological Development: Ukrainian Organizations
						
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- Ukrainian organizations made public a joint statement on Feb. 12 hailing the DPRK's successful third underground nuclear test. They included the Dnepropetrovsk Branch of the "Treasured Sword of Songun" Association for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Soviet Officers' Union and the Sovetski Tsentr.
					 Through the recent successful nuclear test the DPRK once again demonstrated to the world its high level of scientific and technological development and achievements made in socialist construction, the statement said.
					
					 It bitterly condemned the U.S. and its followers, criminals who shipped nuclear weapons into the Korean Peninsula and spawned the nuclear issue, for their hypercritical acts.
					
					 It said:
					
					 It is their trite method to pick a quarrel with independent states over their legitimate right.
					
					 To denuclearize the U.S. and other powers is prerequisite for global peace and security.
					
					 The statement extended support and solidarity to the heroic Korean people in their just cause.

articles.title: Swiss Organizations Hail DPRK's Successful Nuclear Test
articles.content:
Swiss Organizations Hail DPRK's Successful Nuclear Test
						
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea released a joint statement on Feb. 13 to hail the DPRK's successful third underground nuclear test.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The DPRK conducted the third underground nuclear test.
					
					 This was an answer to the intensified hostile acts of the U.S. which wantonly violated the legitimate right of the DPRK to space development and satellite launch for peaceful purposes.
					
					 It also serves as part of countermeasures for protecting the sovereignty and security of the DPRK.
					
					 The imperialist reactionaries' sheer sophism about the "danger" of a nuclear test can never frighten the DPRK.
					
					 The nuclear test conducted by it was aimed at self-defence, to all intents and purposes, and poses no threat to any one.
					
					 It would make positive contribution to protecting the peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula and in the Asia-Pacific region.
					
					 We warmly hail the DPRK's successful third underground nuclear test.

articles.title: DPRK Reliably Defends Regional Peace: Moldavian
articles.content:
DPRK Reliably Defends Regional Peace: Moldavian
						
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- The chairman of the Anti-Imperialist Association of Songun Revolution for the Study of the Juche Idea in  Moldova made public a statement on Feb. 13 in support of the DPRK's successful third underground nuclear test.
					 The statement said that the nuclear test conducted by the DPRK was a sure answer to the moves of the U.S. imperialists and their stooges against it.
					
					 It noted all the senseless stories spread by them against fresh achievements made by people's Korea do not deserve even a passing note. 
					
					 The DPRK, a socialist state, is reliably defending regional peace.
					
					 The Songun politics of the DPRK and its access to nukes together with the immortal Juche idea greatly encourage all those who are struggling for independence of the popular masses.

articles.title: Danish, Pakistani Personages Hail DPRK's Successful Nuclear Test
articles.content:
Danish, Pakistani Personages Hail DPRK's Successful Nuclear Test
						
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- Danish and Pakistani personages issued statements on Feb. 12 and 14 to hail the DPRK's successful third underground nuclear test.
					 Anders Kristensen, chairman of the Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association, said:
					
					 The DPRK conducted the third underground nuclear test in a safe and perfect manner despite the U.S. hostile policy and arbitrary practices.
					
					 By origin, the DPRK felt no need to conduct the nuclear test nor had any plan to do so.
					
					 The nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula spawned as the U.S. and its followers violated the sovereignty of the DPRK from A to Z.
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean warlike forces have worked hard to put military pressure on the DPRK and suffocate its economy, while crying out for a preemptive nuclear attack on it.
					
					 In December last year, they prodded the UN Security Council to cook up a "resolution on sanctions" against the DPRK over its satellite launch, wantonly encroaching upon its sovereignty in disregard of its legitimate rights.
					
					 The U.S. should roll back its hostile policy toward the DPRK, respect its sovereignty and solve all problems through dialogue and negotiations.
					
					 Some Western media are misleading public opinion to give impression that the DPRK deliberately escalates tension.
					
					 The issue will be settled if the U.S. and its followers give up hostile policy toward the DPRK and respect its sovereignty.
					
					 Shahida Wijarat, chairman of the Society for the Study of Self-Reliance of Pakistan, said that the DPRK's successful nuclear test increased support and deepened trust of the people in their leader.
					
					 He wished the DPRK success in its efforts for the country's peace and prosperity.

articles.title: DPRK Has Right to Pursue Nuclear Program: Russians
articles.content:
DPRK Has Right to Pursue Nuclear Program: Russians
						
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- Russian organization and personage congratulated the DPRK on its successful third underground nuclear test.
					 The Dagestan Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in its letter on Feb. 13 extended sincere congratulations to the leadership and the people of the DPRK on their successful nuclear test, saying:
					
					 It is the right of the DPRK to shape and carry out its nuclear program.
					
					 Russia has great interests in peace and stability in the Far Eastern Region.
					
					 However, such peace and stability are possible only when the DPRK accesses nuclear deterrence as the U.S. and forces following it pursue the policy of aggression and double standards.
					
					 The letter wished the DPRK greater success in bolstering its nuclear deterrence.
					
					 On the same day Viktor Yegorov, chairman of the Karelia-DPRK Friendship Association, made public the following statement:
					
					 The DPRK's nuclear test serves as a substantial countermeasure to protect its security and sovereignty from the vicious moves of the U.S. and its followers who wantonly encroached upon the DPRK's legitimate right to launch satellite for peaceful purposes.
					
					 The nuclear test demonstrated to the world the will and might of Songun Korea.
					
					 The recent nuclear test is a just step for self-defence, not contrary to any international law.
					
					 The UN Security Council should make an apology to the DPRK for encroaching upon its sovereignty in pursuance of the U.S. hostile policy toward it and repeal the unreasonable "resolution on sanctions" on it.

articles.title: DPRK's Nuclear Test Is Just Measure for Self-Defence: Peruvian Organization, Swedish Figure
articles.content:
DPRK's Nuclear Test Is Just Measure for Self-Defence: Peruvian Organization, Swedish Figure
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- A Peruvian body and Swedish personage said in articles posted on their websites that the nuclear test conducted by the DPRK is a just measure for self-defence.
					 The Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship in an article on Feb. 12 extended warm congratulations to Kim Jong Un, supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, for leading the 3rd underground nuclear test to success in the wake of the satellite launch by dint of the great Songun politics, sending once again full support and solidarity to the Korean people.
					
					 The success of the nuclear test conducted as a legitimate measure for self-defence is an event which greatly encouraged all the Koreans and other revolutionaries and anti-imperialist fighters in the world, the article noted.
					
					 As long as the army and people of the DPRK are under the Songun leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un, they will smash the moves of the U.S. and its stooges to stifle the DPRK to reliably defend the sovereignty and dignity of the country and reunify it.
					
					 Christer Lundgren, chairman of the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association, in an article on the same day said that the recent nuclear test of the DPRK has defensive and deterrent nature.
					
					 The article is titled "The nuclear test of the DPRK is a measure for self-defence to cope with the U.S. hostile policy."
					
					 It stressed that the U.S. and its allies should make a switchover in its hostile policy toward the DPRK as early as possible to defuse the tension on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: DPRK's Nuclear Test Is Product of U.S. Hostile Policy: Vishwanath
articles.content:
DPRK's Nuclear Test Is Product of U.S. Hostile Policy: Vishwanath
						
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- Vishwanath, director-general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, expressed support for a statement issued by a spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry as regards the 3rd nuclear test conducted by the DPRK to cope with the hostile actions of the U.S.
					 He said in a statement on Feb. 13 that the DPRK's success in the nuclear test serves as an important occasion which demonstrated the national power and independent principle of the DPRK once again to the world.
					
					 The nuclear test of the DPRK is entirely attributable to the hostile policy of the U.S., he said.
					
					 He noted that the UN Security Council's "resolution on sanctions" against the DPRK cooked up by the U.S. and its allies is a wanton violation of the sovereignty of an independent state and a hostile act against it.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to roll back its hostile policy toward the DPRK, not making much fuss about its nuclear test, he said.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Feats Lauded by Foreign Media
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Feats Lauded by Foreign Media
						
 Pyongyang, February 20 (KCNA) -- Foreign papers and magazines carried special write-ups to celebrate the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The Russian paper Our Home Sochi on Feb. 7 carried an article titled "Socialism is destiny of people" with photos documenting revolutionary activities of Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The article mentioned the struggle to defend socialism in the DPRK in the late 20th century, saying Kim Jong Il enforced the Songun politics in all fields to protect socialism from the vicious moves of the imperialists.
					
					 It was thanks to his guidance that the Songun revolutionary line, the Songun politics, was fixed as the strategic line and the political mode under socialism to be constantly adhered to by the DPRK as long as imperialism exists, said the article, adding:
					
					 Encouraged by Kim Jong Il's Songun politics, anti-imperialist and independent countries and those countries who aspire for socialism have pressed for attaching importance to the military affairs to defeat the imperialists' domination and interference.
					
					 The exploits performed by Kim Jong Il for accomplishing the cause of socialism will always be remembered by the progressive people.
					
					 A magazine of Hong Kong, China carried in its February issue articles titled "Life of great man recorded in history", "Tender-hearted father of people" with photos of Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The Nepali paper Janmabhumi on Feb. 9 carried an article titled "Place which vividly shows 5 000-year history" with a portrait of a smiling Kim Jong Il. The article introduces the Pyongyang Folklore Park.
					
					 The Pakistani paper Baluchistan Times on Feb. 10 carried an article titled "Leader Kim Jong Il and Korean People's Army", which praised his Songun leadership feats.

articles.title: Seran invitados a Pyongyang los contribuyentes al exito de prueba nuclear
articles.content:
Seran invitados a Pyongyang los contribuyentes al exito de prueba nuclear
						
Pyongyang, 20 de febrero (ACNC) -- Segun la medida benevola del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, seran invitados a esta capital los cientificos, tecnicos, obreros, constructores militares y funcionarios quienes demostraron a todo el mundo el inagotable poderio de la potencia del monte Paektu al realizar con exito la tercera prueba nuclear subterranea.
					  Ese exito es un acontecimiento de importancia especial que se produjo gracias a la ferrea conviccion, voluntad e incomparable coraje del Mariscal Kim Jong Un, General Insigne del Paektu. Igualmente, es evento historico que trajo la lucha abnegada de los cientificos, tecnicos, obreros, constructores militares y funcionarios que defendieron a ultranza el partido, la revolucion, la patria y el pueblo en la linea avanzada del enfrentamiento con el imperialismo norteamericano.
					
					En su visita a Pyongyang, los invitados seran tratados con el maximo privilegio y preferencia.
					
					Rendiran homenaje al Dirigente Kim Jong Il en el Palacio del Sol Kumsusan, donde se conserva su cuerpo y visitaran la casa natal del Presidente Kim Il Sung en Mangyongdae y otros varios lugares de esta capital. 
					
					Los invitados tendran gratos de los agradables dias que van a pasar en el Centro de Patinaje al Aire Libre del Pueblo, el Patinadero de Ruedas y otras creaciones monumentales de la epoca.

articles.title: En Pyongyang los contribuyentes a la prueba nuclear
articles.content:
En Pyongyang los contribuyentes a la prueba nuclear 
						
Pyongyang, 20 de febrero (ACNC) -- Llegaron el dia 20 a esta capital los cientificos, tecnicos, obreros, constructores militares y funcionarios quienes con la exitosa tercera prueba nuclear subterranea manifestaron una vez mas el temperamento de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea de cumplir lo decidido. 
					Desde la encrucijada de Changjon hasta la Plaza Kim Il Sung, el Gran Teatro de Pyongyang, la Avenida Yonggwang, y el Hotel Coryo de Pyongyang los ciudadanos con ramos de flores en sus manos les dieron una calurosa bienvenida a los heroes de la nacion.
					
					Cuando llegaron al Hotel Coryo de Pyongyang, el secretario Pak To Chun y  otros funcionarios del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y los empleados del hotel les acogieron calurosamente colgandoles o entregandoles los collares  y ramos de flores.

articles.title: Mitines de militares y civiles para felicitar la tercera prueba nuclear subterranean
articles.content:
Mitines de militares y civiles para felicitar la tercera prueba nuclear subterranea 
Pyongyang, 20 de febrero (ACNC) -- Tienen lugar en las ciudades y distritos los mitines de militares y civiles para felicitar la tercera prueba nuclear subterranea con la participacion de los funcionarios de los organismos locales del partido, el poder e entidades de masas, los oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea, los funcionarios de las fabricas, empresas, granjas cooperativas, universidades y escuelas especializadas, los trabajadores y los jovenes y estudiantes. 
					En los mitines efectuados en las ciudades de Kaesong y Manpho y en los distritos de Ryongchon y Chonnae los oradores senalaron que es el brillante fruto de la sabia guia del Partido del Trabajo de Corea el gran triunfo en la tercera prueba nuclear que manifesto a todo el mundo la ilimitada voluntad y la capacidad de la Corea del Songun por la defensa de la soberania.
					
					En los mitines realizados en los distritos de Tongrim, Cholsan, Usi y Ryongrim los oradores rindieron la maxima gloria y el mas calido agradecimiento al Mariscal Kim Jong Un quien conduce sabiamente la lucha por glorificar la dignidad del pais y nacion defendiendo con firmeza las preciosas herencias revolucionarias de los grandes Generalisimos. 
					
					En los actos realizados en los distritos de Uiju, Paechon y Chosan los oradores dijeron que ya paso para siempre la era en que los enemigos amenazaban a Corea con las bombas atomicas. 
					
					En los actos efectuados en los distritos de Yonan, Junggang, Thongchon y Chongdan los oradores llamaron a todos a exaltar el honor del ejercito y pueblo independientes y hacer brillar con orgullosos meritos el presente ano significativo del 65o aniversario de la fundacion de la RPDC y el 60o aniversario del triunfo en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria.

articles.title: Emitidos sellos con imagen de Kim Jong Un
articles.content:
Emitidos sellos con imagen de Kim Jong Un
						
Pyongyang, 20 de febrero (ACNC) -- En la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea se dieron a luz los sellos (un papel enterizo de pequeno tamano) llevando la imagen del Mariscal Kim Jong Un pronunciando el discurso por el Ano Nuevo 2013 y los otros (un papel enterizo y 4 sellos individuales) que reflejan las tareas presentadas en este mensaje. 
					En el papel enterizo de pequeno tamano se ve la imagen del Mariscal con las salvas en el trasfondo.
					
					El papel enterizo con la consigna "!Abramos una fase trascendental para la construccion de una potencia economica, con el mismo espiritu y temple con que exploramos el cosmos!" contiene los sellos que reflejan las tareas por sectores presentadas en el mensaje del Ano Nuevo del Mariscal. 
					
					El papel individual bajo el titulo "Gran Kimilsungismo-Kimjongilismo" describe a un militar, un obrero, una campesina y un estudiante entrelazandose los brazos y demuestra la firme voluntad del ejercito y  pueblo coreanos de consolidar por todos los medios, uniendose solidamente en torno al Partido, el poderio politico y militar del pais este ano en que se celebraran el 65o aniversario de la fundacion de la RPDC y el 60o aniversario del triunfo en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria. 
					
					El sello con el tema "La agricultura y la industria ligera son frentes principales de la construccion economica de este ano" refleja los contenidos de activar la produccion en los cuatro sectores prioritarios de la economia nacional, o sea, la industria carbonifera, la electrica, la metalurgica y el transporte ferroviario y preparar el trampolin de la construccion de la potencia economica a base del desarrollo de la ciencia y tecnica. 
					
					Otros sellos llaman a abrir la nueva era de prosperidad del siglo XXI promoviendo la construccion de un Estado civilizado socialista, eliminar la confrontacion Norte-Sur y ejecutar cabalmente la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio y la Declaracion del 4 de Octubre para realizar la causa de reunificacion de la patria en la posicion de dar prioridad a la propia nacion coreana y de lograr la unidad nacional.
